project.teaser: ONE-BLUE will provide an integrated assessment of contaminants of emerging concern (CECs) and their impacts, will develop new monitoring tools, and will provide an advanced understanding of the combined effects of CECs and climate change (CC) on the different marine ecosystems...
project.objective: ONE-BLUE will provide an integrated assessment of contaminants of emerging concern (CECs) and their impacts, will develop new monitoring tools, and will provide an advanced understanding of the combined effects of CECs and climate change (CC) on the different marine ecosystems and their biodiversity. The following objectives are defined: • Improve the current knowledge of the concentrations, profiles, fate, behaviour, and effects of CECs, in the different marine compartments and ecosystems through three case studies (Atlantic and Arctic oceans and the Mediterranean Sea) and develop safety guidelines and protocols for future CECs monitoring in marine ecosystems. • Provide an advanced understanding of possible interaction between CC and CECs in marine ecosystems with studies under controlled conditions in marine mesocosms. • Develop a database (DB), the CECsMarineDB, following FAIR principles, with a database management system (DBMS) to collect the data generated in ONE-BLUE and capitalize data from other projects and existing DBs. A graphical user interface (GUI) will be developed and used for data exploration and demonstration of the fate and behaviour of CECs in a changing environment. • Provide new solutions in support of the implementation of relevant EU policies; (i) a series of new approach methodologies (NAMs) to improve the ecotoxicity assessment of CECs in marine ecosystems; (ii) a tiered effect-directed approaches (EDA) combining toxicological assessment and chemical analysis; (iii) an advanced ultrasonic system for sampling and enrichment micro/nanoplastics from seawater; (iv) a remote autonomous sensor to assess CECs in marine waters in quasi-real-time; a decision support system (DSS) based on machine and deep learning strategies to assess and forecast combined effects of CC and CECs in marine ecosystems. • Disseminate the project results and establish the exploitation plan for the developed technologies.
project.title: Integrated approach to assess the levels and impact of cONtaminants of Emerging concern on BLUE health and biodiversity modulated by climate change drivers.
project.keywords: CECs, effect-based monitoring, EDA, microbial biodiversity, Database, DSS, guidelines

result.title: Integrated Assessment of Contaminants of Emerging Concern (CECs) and Their Impacts in Marine Ecosystems: Mediterranean Case Study

details.authors: C. Mariani, S. Valsecchi, S. Polesello, M. Rusconi, C. Centelleghe, M. Pauletto, M. Brailo Šćepanović, A. Bratoš Cetinić, E. Cotou, N. Politakis, I. Hatzianestis, H. Kaberi, C. Tsangaris, M. Parolini, J. Larrachea Coscarat, M. Llorca, M. Farré Urgell, M.T
details.journalTitle: SETAC Europe 35th Annual Meeting – Book of Abstracts (Vienna, May 2025)
details.publisher: Society of Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry (SETAC Europe)

result.title: Proceedings of the meetings, technical meetings, and courses of the first year
result.description: This deliverable reflects the activity under task 5.8 and reports a summary of the meetings and courses carried out during the first year of the project.

result.title: First official poster
result.description: ONE-BLUE presentation poster (su-task T5.2.3) with the summary of ONE-BLUE objectives, expected outcomes, WPs, sampling campaigns planned and beneficiaries involved.

result.title: ONE-BLUE data dictionary 1
result.description: Summary of the literature database review in sub-task T4.1.1.It compiles the literature and database review to identify the data properties and links to chemical and marine semantic resources.

result.title: Video-abstract of the project
result.description: The sub-task T5.2.5 will deliver the first video-abstract of the ONE-BLUE project that will be available on the ONE-BLUE website.

result.title: Kick-off meeting proceedings
result.description: Proceedings of the kick-off meeting of ONE-BLUE project (Task 5.1).

result.title: ONE-BLUE Sampling Plan for all case study areas
result.description: "This deliverable summarizes the activity under task 1.1.""Sampling and oceanography campaigns"". It describes the plan and the sampling organization at all case studies (Mediterranean case study no 1, Atlantic case study no 2, and Arctic case study no 3), the complementary information expected in each sampling area.The number of samples planned, the description of sampling areas and their interest."

result.title: First year e-newsletter and press releases
result.description: The first e-newsletter of the ONE-BLUE will be available online through the website at month 12 as a result of the initial activity under Task 5.5

result.title: Report on selection of CECs mixtures to be tested
result.description: This deliverable reflects the activity under task 2.1, Selection of CECs mixtures, to carry out the mesocosms studies.The selection of contaminants of emerging concern that will be used to spike the mesocosms will be made to provide the maximum information. Therefore, it will be done to emulate realistic concentrations and mixtures of exposure of contaminants of emerging concern, according to the case study results, and also according to a prioritization of the contaminants with those showing a priory higher risk.

result.title: Executive summary of the sampling in case study 1- Mediterranean case study
result.description: "This deliverable describes the activity under the sub-task T1.1.2 ""Mediterranean case study no.1"". It summarizes the samples collected, the sampling sites, potential problems during the sampling campaign and the applied contingency actions, their distribution to the different laboratories involved in ONE-BLUE for the respective chemical, microbiological, and toxicological studies, and provides the results of the physicochemical analysis carried out during the sampling campaign."

result.title: First version of ONE-BLUE database management system
result.description: This deliverable will compile Task 4.2 and subtasks T4.2.1 and T4.2.2, the first prototype of the database management system (DBMS) for the CECsMarineDB, incorporating data publishing, curation, and security components.

result.title: Tracing Contaminants in Seafood Across the Global Ocean: Current Status and Future Management Directions

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable compiles activity in Task 6.2 and task 6.4, and the initial data management plan for ONE-BLUE project.

result.title: Technologies 3D video
result.description: The main result of task T5.6 will be a 3D video presenting the different technologies developed within the project.

result.title: ONE-BLUE Harmonized Analytical Plan for the different case studies and analytical determinations
result.description: "This deliverable describes the activity under the sub-task T1.2.1 ""Harmonized analytical methods"". Therefore, it describes the harmonized analytical methods that will be applied by the different analytical laboratories participating in ONE-BLUE to conduct the chemical analysis of the samples according to the quality requirements and results comparison."

result.title: Final Report of the of the different sampling and oceanographic campaigns and the global vision and the combined information expected from the different areas
result.description: "This deliverable describes the activity under task T1.1, ""Sampling and oceanographic campaigns"" and the sub-tasks T1.1.1, T1.1.2, T1.1.3 and T1.1.4.It summarizes the samples collected during the 3 case studies (Mediterranean no 1, Atlantic no 2 and Arctic no 3), the samples finally collected vs samples that were planned and the explanation if there are significant differences. Problems encountered during the sampling campaigns and how they were solved.A summary of the delivery and distribution of the samples among the different samples and studies will be provided."

result.title: Executive summary of the sampling campaigns in case study 3- Arctic Ocean case study
result.description: "This deliverable describes the activity under the sub-task T1.1.4 ""Arctic case study no.3"". It summarizes the samples collected, the sampling sites, potential problems during the sampling campaign and the applied contingency actions, their distribution to the different laboratories involved in ONE-BLUE for the respective chemical, microbiological, and toxicological studies, and provides the results of the physicochemical analysis carried out during the sampling campaign."

result.title: Policy recommendations and safety guidelines (initial version)
result.description: Under Task 5.9 Safety Guidelines and EU Policy recommendations will be developed in combination with the CONTRAST PROJECT. These recommendations will be evolved along the project with the new results and data obtained. At month 17 the first policy recommendations and safety guidelines will be delivered.

result.title: Clustering with other related projects and EU initiatives initial
result.description: Report of the first-period clustering activities with other projects aligned with ONE-BLUE under activity of task 5.7.

result.title: Weak effects of conventional and biodegradable microplastics on marine microbial communities

category.title: sensors
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/sensors

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
